intro: Ranunculus acriformis var. aestivalis, commonly known as the early buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to eight petal-like sepals that resemble true petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with simple, alternate, trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
